programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2005/06 season. Jose Mourinho continued his success with Chelsea, Alan Shearer broke Newcastle's scoring record and Harry Redknapp rescued Portsmouth from the drop.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2006/07 season. Ashley Cole began life at Chelsea, Arsene Wenger celebrated his 10th year in charge and West Ham snapped up Carlos Tevez and Javier Mascherano.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2007/08 season. Jose Mourinho's first tenure as Chelsea manager ended, Cristiano Ronaldo topped the scoring charts and Fulham dramatically escaped relegation.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2008/09 season. Manchester City began a new era under new ownership, Manchester United secured a third successive title and Newcastle were dramatically relegated.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2009/10 season. Top scorer Didier Drogba fired Chelsea to the title, Manchester City spent big and Spurs secured Champions League qualification for the first time.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2010/11 season. Man Utd surpassed Liverpool's record of 18 top-flight titles, Man City secured the signing of Yaya Toure and Wolves dramatically avoided relegation.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2011/12 season. As the competition entered its 20th year, Man City won their first title in dramatic fashion and Wigan produced a great escape to avoid the drop.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2012/13 season. Sir Alex Ferguson ended his managerial career as Manchester United clinched their 13th Premier League title and FA Cup winners Wigan were relegated.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2013/14 season. Manchester City clinched their second Premier League title, Jose Mourinho returned to Chelsea and Tony Pulis masterminded a great escape at Palace.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2014/15 season. Eden Hazard's superb form helped Chelsea clinch their fifth title and newly-promoted Burnley and QPR made immediate returns to the Championship.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: A review of the 2015/16 season. Leicester City shocked the footballing world, Jose Mourinho's second tenure at Chelsea came to an end and Newcastle dropped into the second tier.

programme.title: Classic Premier League
programme.desc: Take a look back at the 2016/17 Premier League season as Chelsea win their fifth Premier League title and reigning champions Leicester set a new record for worst title defence.

programme.title: Too Good to Go Down
programme.desc: Exploring the difficulty of the post-Sir Matt Busby era at Manchester United and why hitting rock bottom was the only way for a new United to come of age.

programme.title: Pound Land
programme.desc: A look at the trials and tribulations of Ken Bates and Matthew Harding - Chelsea's trailblazing forces of the 1980s and 1990s.

programme.title: The Boot Room Boys
programme.desc: A look at how Liverpool's unique club culture underpinned the club's success. Featuring contributions from Jurgen Klopp, Ian Rush, Phil Thompson and many more.

programme.title: Rocky & Wrighty: From Brockley to the Big Time
programme.desc: The story of how a young David Rocastle's meteoric rise to stardom inspired another legend in the shape of Ian Wright.

programme.title: Playing for Our Future
programme.desc: Asking what the future holds for sport in the battle against global warming. Reshmin Chowdhury meets people at all levels to discuss how sport can be a positive force for change.

programme.title: The Grudge
programme.desc: A look at the Five Nations rugby clash between Scotland and England in 1990, a match which saw both sides going for a potential Grand Slam.

programme.title: Unbreakable: England 2003
programme.desc: A celebratory look back at England's Rugby World Cup-winning team of 2003, as well as some of the difficulties the players have experienced as a result.

programme.title: True Grit

programme.desc: The Alouettes and Roughriders duel in the 112th Grey Cup. Both teams needed semifinal heroics, with Tommy Nield's touchdown catch with 12 seconds left getting Saskatchewan by BC 24-21, while Montreal upset Hamilton 19-16 on a last-second field goal.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: While examining a 9-year-old girl after a car crash, doctors find that she has been molested and call in Benson and Stabler, who learn that the girl's attacker has killed another child.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a teenage girl disappears, a psychic (guest star Martin Short) is brought into the investigation.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Stabler goes under cover as a sex offender to gain the trust of a serial rapist released from jail, but his cover is blown, putting his life in danger.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A distraught pregnant woman threatens suicide, claiming that her child is a product of rape, but when the case goes to trial, the woman's willingness to settle for cash makes detectives suspicious.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a series of rapes is linked to a speed-dating service, Benson goes under cover and discovers Mike Jergens (Dean Cain) is the assailant.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: When a runaway teenage girl is found badly beaten, doctors discover the beating killed her unborn child, and detectives begin to question the father.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: An investigation into the near-fatal beating of a 12-year-old boy uncovers a female suspect whose trial becomes about the rights of same-sex parents.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: A child dies in the emergency room after passing out during a prayer vigil at a late-night church service.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The search for the sexual abuser of a child leads the detectives to a wealthy toy mogul known for his generous hospitality toward children.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: Detectives try to decipher a motive for the strangulation of a Bronx assistant DA in an area where hookers stroll.

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit
programme.desc: The death of a wealthy senior citizen leads to an investigations that uncovers a serial killer who targets the elderly.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
programme.desc: Adaptation of the first of J.K. Rowling's popular children's novels about Harry Potter, a boy who learns on his eleventh birthday that he is the orphaned son of two powerful wizards and possesses unique magical powers of his own. He is summoned from his life as an unwanted child to become a student at Hogwarts, an English boarding school for wizards. There, he meets several friends who become his

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets
programme.desc: The follow-up to "Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone" finds young wizard Harry Potterand his friends, Ron and Hermione, facing new challenges during their second year at Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry as they try to discover a dark force that is terrorizing the school.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Prisoner of Azkaban
programme.desc: Harry Potter's (Daniel Radcliffe) third year at Hogwarts starts off badly when he learns deranged killer Sirius Black (Gary Oldman) has escaped from Azkaban prison and is bent on murdering the teenage wizard. While Hermione's (Emma Watson) cat torments Ron's (Rupert Grint) sickly rat, causing a rift among the trio, a swarm of nasty Dementors is sent to protect the school from Black. A mysterious n

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Goblet of Fire
programme.desc: During Harry's fourth year at Hogwarts a competition will be held between three schools of wizardry, and contestants will be magically chosen for the very dangerous event.

programme.title: Dr. Seuss' How the Grinch Stole Christmas
programme.desc: Based on the beloved children's book by Dr. Seuss, "How the Grinch Stole Christmas" follows the exploits of the title character who is infuriated by the celebration he sees down in Whoville each year at Christmastime. programme.title: Red One
programme.desc: When a villain kidnaps Santa Claus from the North Pole, an E.L.F. (Extremely Large and Formidable) operative joins forces with the world's most accomplished tracker to find him and save Christmas.

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Order of the Phoenix
programme.desc: Now in his fifth year at Hogwarts, Harry learns that many in the wizarding community do not know the truth of his encounter with Lord Voldemort. Cornelius Fudge, minister of Magic, appoints his toady, Dolores Umbridge, as Defense Against the Dark Arts teacher, for he fears that professor Dumbledore will take his job. But her teaching is deficient and her methods, cruel, so Harry prepares a group o

programme.title: Harry Potter and the Half-Blood Prince
programme.desc: As Death Eaters wreak havoc in both Muggle and Wizard worlds, Hogwarts is no longer a safe haven for students. Though Harry suspects there are new dangers lurking within the castle walls, Dumbledore is more intent than ever on preparing the young wizard for the final battle with Voldemort. Teenage hormones run rampant through Hogwarts, presenting a different sort of danger. Love may be in the air,
